answerText: Charles-Louis de Secondat, baron de La Brède et de Montesquieu [accept either][10] Montesquieu's Spirit of the Laws advocated setting up a democratic government with this property, in which law-making, law-interpreting, and law-enforcing functions are performed by different bodies.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 14 - Finals 2 | 14 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One of this man's accomplishments was creating the term "feudalism", and also wrote works on gravity and the renal glands. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author who wrote some correspondences between the travelers Usbeck and Rica entitled Persian Letters. He also sorted governments into republics, monarchies, and dictatorships in The Spirit of the Laws.
